item.title: 45 pass electrical-engineer upgrade exam - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

The Professional Regulation Commission announced Friday that 45 candidates passed the Technical Evaluation for the Upgrading as Professional Electrical Engineers, which was conducted by the Board of Electrical Engineering in Manila this month. See the full list of passers here.

item.title: Contractors’ gathering set - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Contractors’ gathering set  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Construction Industry Tripartite Council (CITC) will conduct a Contractor Summit at The Ritz Hotel Garden Oases on July 28 and 29. Concerns of contractors and the labor law will be discussed. CITC is a joint council of the Department of Labor and Employment (Dole), contractors, and the professionals including engineers and doctors, among others. “During the summit, there will be a seminar for the labor laws particularly on construction and also the environmental aspects of construction,” said Philippine Institute of Civil Engineers (Pice) Board of Director engineer Eddie Fuentes, who al...

item.title: Duterte: Be of service to fellow Filipinos - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Duterte: Be of service to fellow Filipinos  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines) — President Rodrigo Duterte attended on Tuesday the launch "Amazing Grace," the Philippine Red Cross' (PRC) relief and recovery ship, which he hoped would encourage Filipinos to be of service to their countrymen. "Amazing Grace," is a state-of-the-art relief and recovery ship that "shall serve as the realization of the PRC's vision of effectively responding to any disaster anywhere in the country." The President added that with the vessel, the PRC would be able to effectively help government forces "in providing immediate relief assistance during emergency and...

item.title: OFW one-stop service center launched in Davao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
OFW one-stop service center launched in Davao  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Department of Labor and Employment (Dole) officially opened the first One-Stop Service Center for Overseas Filipino Workers (Ossco) in Davao City on Friday, August 11, at the fifth floor of Gaisano Mall of Davao. Dole Secretary Silvestre Bello III said Ossco-Davao, co-managed by Dole, is the 14th OFW service center in the country in pursuant to the directive of President Rodrigo Duterte to house all key government agencies in one service center to help OFWs save money and time in securing all needed documents and requirements before they could work overseas or upon their return to their...

item.title: Clark's OFW processing center served over 22,400 clients - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Clark's OFW processing center served over 22,400 clients  Sun.Star Philippines

CLARK -- Over 22,400 clients were already served by the Overseas Filipino Workers (OFW) One-Stop Processing Center (OSPC) inside the Clark Freeport Zone four months since it started its operation. “The existence of the OFW OPSC at Clark Polytechnic was able to cut down the process cycle time for most of our (and our partners) services making it convenient for our OFW-clients traversing through the Clark International Airport and other clients residing from nearby areas,” Department of Labor and Employment (Dole) Regional Director Ana Dione said in a statement. Records show from September 12...

item.title: Architects group president to strengthen professional programs - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Architects group president to strengthen professional programs  Sun.Star Philippines

CITY OF SAN FERNANDO -- United Architects of the Philippines (UAP) Angeles City Chapter president Andy Gulapa on Sunday, May 7, vowed to support fellow architects to earn points under the Continuing Professional Development (CPD) program as required by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) for the renewal of licences. According to PRC, the CPD as mandatory requirement in the renewal of professional license under Section 10 of R.A. 10912 shall be implemented after the effectivity of the Implementing Rules and Regulations (IRR) which will be in March 2017. Gulapa said that their group ...

item.title: CTU grad grabs 3rd spot in Electrical Engineer board exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CTU grad grabs 3rd spot in Electrical Engineer board exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of Cebu Technological University (CTU)-Main Campus ranked third in the September 2017 Registered Electrical Engineer Licensure Examination, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced on Thursday night, September 7. Daryl Densing Arizo achieved a score of 91.40 percent in the exam. Edilbert Vallecera Tandaan of Camarines Sur Polytechnic College-Nabua ranked first with 91.80 percent; Ronel Del Rosario Mananap of University of Batangas (UB) placed second with 91.70 percent; Sharing the fourth place are Gener Leynes Atienza, still of UB, and John Eric Aquino Varias of the...

item.title: #RCAC2017: Follow the guide, tag a career, like the future - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
#RCAC2017: Follow the guide, tag a career, like the future  Sun.Star Philippines

GUIDANCE counselors and career advocates have gathered once again during the recently concluded Regional Career Advocacy Congress (RCAC) 2017. RCAC, now in its fourth year, was held last September 19 to 20, 2017 at RDR Gym in Tagum City. The organizing committee of the event is spearheaded by the Department of Labor and Employment (Dole), Department of Education, Department of Science and Technology, Commission on Higher Education, Technical Education and Skills Development Authority, and Professional Regulation Commission. With more than 500 participants this year, composed of the members ...

item.title: Close to 1,000 applicants join job fair in Iloilo - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Close to 1,000 applicants join job fair in Iloilo  Sun.Star Philippines

CLOSE to 1,000 applicants trooped to the Iloilo Provincial Capitol on Friday, June 2, for the one-day job and tourism fair facilitated by the Provincial Government through its Public Employment Services Office (Peso). “We have local companies. There are companies for overseas employment. For local employment we have Robinson’s, SM, and BPO’s. For overseas, we have from Manila, Cebu, and Negros,” Francisco Heler, department head and Peso manager said. Teletech-Iloilo was one of the participating companies. “We’ve been supporting this kind of activity ever since. It’s really a good way to rep...

item.title: PRC bares licensure exams in Davao - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PRC bares licensure exams in Davao  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Professional Regulatory Commission (PRC)-Davap released on Friday, December 23, the list of schedules of the different Board Licensure Examinations, which will be conducted in Davao City in 2017. PRC-Davap executive officer Lawyer May Suzanne Puentespina-Ciudadano said, in a press statement that the list of schedules will serve as guide for all its clientele in Southern Mindanao. The commission released the dates of examinations including the opening of online processing and the deadlines for filing of applications. For January 2017, board examinations for architects are set on January ...

item.title: To have professional licenses renewed under new rules in PH, here's the cost - Rappler
item.description:
To have professional licenses renewed under new rules in PH, here's the cost  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Professionals renewing their licenses with the Professional Regulatory Commission (PRC) will potentially have to shell out, as the agency begins implementing the law requiring workers to constantly seek opportunities to boost their skills. Republic Act 10912 or the Continuing Professional Development Act of 2016 requires professionals to earn a specific number of units before their licenses are renewed. The units will be acquired through development programs, like seminars, graduate studies, and online courses, among others. They come with costs, of course. More than...

item.title: USC graduate tops Aug. 2017 pharmacist licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
USC graduate tops Aug. 2017 pharmacist licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A CEBUANO graduate of the University of San Carlos (USC) topped the August 2017 Pharmacist Licensure Examination. The list of successful examinees released by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) showed that Jannylene Rose Tolentino Chua ranked first, with a rating of 91.10 percent. Kimberly Tan Lomantas of the University of the Immaculate Conception-Davao ranked second with a rating of 91.05. Chua is the lone graduate of a Cebu school who landed in the top 10, which was dominated by graduates of the University of the Philippines-Manila and the University of Santo Tomas. Chua, 20, ...

item.title: 2 University of Mindanao grads top criminology board - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 University of Mindanao grads top criminology board  Sun.Star Philippines

ONE criminology graduate from the University of Mindanao ranked first in the Criminologist Licensure Examination in June, while another ranked fourth. Gander Quillip from the University of Mindanao (UM)-Digos College topped the exam with an 88.40 percent rate, while Joel Quibol from University of Mindanao (UM)-Tagum College ranked fourth with 87.90 percent. At second place is Matthew Solomon from ICCT Colleges Foundation with 88.35 percent, followed by John Carlo Fetalvero from Bestlik College of the Philippines at third place with 87.95 percent. Ambot Agway from Maila Rosario College Tugue...

item.title: 2 SLU grads among Social Worker board topnotchers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 SLU grads among Social Worker board topnotchers  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO GRADUATES of Saint Louis University (SLU) are among the Top 10 of the July 2017 Social Worker licensure examination. Tracee Joy Sab-it Guinyawan placed fourth with a rating of 84.50 percent while Amy Angeli Bongaoil Cabansi is in ninth place with 84.00 percent rating. SLU had a 90.91 percent passing rate with 140 passers out of the 154 examinees. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced 3,951 out of 5,997 passed the Social Worker Licensure Examination given by the Board for Social Workers in the cities of Manila, Baguio, Cagayan de Oro, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo, Legazpi, Lucena...

item.title: Two Cebu grads top Guidance Counselor exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Two Cebu grads top Guidance Counselor exam  Sun.Star Philippines

CEBU CITY -- Two gradutaes from the Cebu Normal University landed on the top ten students who passed the August 2017 Guidance Counselor Board Exam released by the Professional Regulation Commission on Thursday night, August 7. Jaseluh Remolador Saturninas got the third highest score with 88.75 percent while Marie Donnaelle Olo Yan got the 10th spot with a score of 87.55 percent. Rachelle Abadilla Bersamin of Ateneo de Davao University got the highest rank with 90.15 percent, Kent Jan Aguirre Beldia of the Univerisity of the Philippines (UP)-Visayas-Iloilo City got the second rank with 89.30...

item.title: 4 Cebuano grads top Civil Engineer Licensure Examination - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
4 Cebuano grads top Civil Engineer Licensure Examination  Sun.Star Philippines

FOUR Cebuano graduates made it to the top 10 of the November 2016 Civil Engineer Licensure Examination. Three graduates from the University of San Carlos were included in the top ten, namely, Samuel Eliezer Yu Uy ranked second with 92.75 percent, Selina Dianne King Bernardo at third place with 92.65 percent, and Franz Josef Jucom Ceniza at 10th place garnering 91.45 percent passing rate. On the ninth place is Jeremias Yang Marquez Jr. of Cebu Institute of Tecnology-University with 91.50 percent. The results were announced by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) on Wednesday, Novemb...

item.title: 4 LET topnotchers from Negros schools - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
4 LET topnotchers from Negros schools  Sun.Star Philippines

FOUR graduates of three schools in Negros Island Region (NIR) were among the topnotchers in the September 2016 Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET), results released on Monday by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) showed. In the elementary level, Romulo Bendo of Kabankalan Catholic College (KCC), with a passing rate of 86.60 percent, landed in eighth place. Ma. Fatima Ofracio of Bacolod City College (BCC) and Dara Tanato of Siliman University (SU) in Dumaguete City, who both garnered 86.40 percent ratings, were ninth placers. In the secondary level, Hector Bailey Calumpiano a...

item.title: 43 OFWs to be hired as teachers under Dole’s program - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
43 OFWs to be hired as teachers under Dole’s program  Sun.Star Philippines

PORAC -- A TOTAL of 43 returning overseas Filipino workers (OFWs) will be given permanent teaching positions in public schools near their residences in the provinces of Aurora, Bulacan, Bataan, Pampanga, Nueva Ecija and Tarlac. Launched in 2014, the “Sa ‘Pinas Ikaw ang Mam at Sir” (Spims) Program by the Department of Labor and Employment (Dole), aims to assist OFWs who are Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) passers working abroad as professional teachers or household service workers to be employed as teachers when they return in the Philippines. This program is a collaboration of Dole...

item.title: Baguio boy tops nursing board exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Baguio boy tops nursing board exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A JEEPNEY driver’s son from Trancoville, Baguio City topped the recent Nurse Licensure Examination. Eric Carolino Jacinto of Saint Louis University shared the number one spot with Faith Calzado Rutagines of the University of Santo Tomas in the recently released results of the November Nurse Licensure Examination with a rating of 86.60 percent. The 21-year-old Baguio native led the 170 new nurses produced by SLU which is the second top performing schools in the recent examinations. Jacinto, the second of four children of driver who manages his jeepney and a housewife, was a consistent honor ...

item.title: SLU is top performing Med Tech school - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
SLU is top performing Med Tech school  Sun.Star Philippines

SAINT LOUIS University (SLU) recently topped the recent Medical Technologist Licensure Examination in the country. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced SLU had a 100 percent passing rate in the Med Tech examination given February 2017. All of the 292 examinees from SLU passed with four of them in the top 10. The topnotchers are David Marco Abaya Bildan which ranked second with a rating of 90.60 percent, Arnold Joseph Octaviano Geronimo ranked fifth with 89.50 percent, Renz Michael Hart Velasco Bautista placed seventh with 89.20 percent, and while at 10th place is Julie Ann...

item.title: Cebu grad places 4th in Physician Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad places 4th in Physician Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A MEDICINE graduate of Southwestern University Matias H. Aznar Memorial College of Medicine in Cebu City placed 4th in March 2017 Physician Licensure Examination. Maude Sang-an Tabigue is the only Cebuano graduate who made it to the top 10 of the recent physician licensure exam with a rating of 87 percent. Karl Emmanuel Cueva Mercader from the University of Perpetual Help System Dalta-Las Piñas ranked first with 88.58 percent rating. The Professional Regulation Commission announced on its website that out of 1,317 examinees, 813 passed the 2017 Physician Licensure Exam given by the the Boar...

item.title: Renewal of professional license in MP set on March 18 - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Renewal of professional license in MP set on March 18  Sun.Star Philippines

BONTOC, Mountain Province – In its effort to bring services closer to the people, the Philippine Regulations Commission (PRC), in coordination with the Provincial Government of Mountain Province, will be conducting mobile outreach services to its clients in the province for their convenience at the Provincial Capitol Building on March 18. The mobile outreach service will be open from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. Public Employment Service Officer Ernesto Emilio said services to be offered are renewal of Professional Identification Cards (PIC) and licenses which expired and will expire on or before...

item.title: Southwestern graduate tops dentist licensure exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Southwestern graduate tops dentist licensure exams  Sun.Star Philippines

A STUDENT of Southwestern University in Cebu topped this year’s licensure examinations for dentists. Gino Arvin Baguio Santos, 23, a Davaoeño, ranked 6th in the exams with 83.03 percent mark. The Professional Regulation Commission released the results two days after the last batch of examinees took the exams last May. The PRC stated that 394 out of 402 people had passed the practical phase while 397 out of 857 had passed the written phase of the test conducted by the Board of Dentistry in Manila. He is the only one in the top ten who came from a university in the Visayas. The rest are from ...

item.title: Philippine Red Cross raises P37-M as it celebrates its 70th anniversary - Rappler
item.description:
Philippine Red Cross raises P37-M as it celebrates its 70th anniversary  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Red Cross (PRC) announced that it has raised a total of P37.79 million in pledges and donations since it launched on April 19 its 70th anniversary Fund and Membership Kick-Off drive. PRC Chairman and Senator Richard Gordon thanked the organization's donors for their generous donations. "These pledges will go a long way in the service of the Filipino people. Thank you to everyone who pledged their support to PRC so we can serve humanity together," said Gordon. The PRC is a humanitarian organization that does not receive government funding but relies heavi...

item.title: Iloilo grad tops June 2017 Nursing Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Iloilo grad tops June 2017 Nursing Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

CEBU -- A graduate of the West Visayas State University-La Paz in Iloilo City topped the June 2017 Nursing Licensure Exam, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced on Friday, June 16. Mary Angelie Cabañez placed first in the exam with the highest score of 86.20 percent. Joining Cabañez in top 10 are seven other graduates of West Visayas State University-Lapaz namely Nechelyn Consular, who placed fourth with a rating of 84.80 percent, Alyssa Jude Montalban, who ranked fifth with a score of 84.60 percent, followed by Joane Christine Pedrola in the sixth place with a rating of 84...

item.title: New Zealand, PRC inaugurate relief warehouse in Tacloban - Rappler
item.description:
New Zealand, PRC inaugurate relief warehouse in Tacloban  Rappler

TACLOBAN CITY, Philippines – New Zealand Ambassador to the Philippines David Strachan and Philippine Red Cross (PRC) Secretary-General Oscar Palabyab inaugurated the new PRC logistics and multi purpose center in the city on Wednesday, December 14. The center is part of New Zealand's P159 million (*$3.184 million) donation to the PRC. According to Palabyab, the newly-constructed warehouse and training center is meant to strengthen PRC's capacity to quickly and efficiently respond to disaster and calamities in Eastern Visayas. "This will serve as the hub of operations during emergencies and n...

item.title: Philippine Red Cross opens vocational school in Leyte - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Philippine Red Cross opens vocational school in Leyte  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Red Cross (PRC) has completed its vocational training center in Tacloban City to enhance employment opportunities in communities affected by Super Typhoon Yolanda nearly four years ago. PRC chairman Senator Richard Gordon, the Kingdom of Bahrain Royal Charity Organization's secretary general Mustafa Al Sayed, PRC secretary general Oscar Palabyab, and key local government officials led the center's inauguration late Friday afternoon, May 19. The facility, which will be accredited by the Technical Education and Skills Development Authority, will offer training courses on electr...

item.title: Red Cross banks on new facility - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Red Cross banks on new facility  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Red Cross (PRC) inaugurated yesterday a blood bank in Jagobiao, Mandaue City that will provide safe blood for anyone in northern Cebu and neighboring provinces who needs it. Sen. Richard Gordon, the PRC chairman and chief executive officer, said the blood bank, located in the PRC Regional Operations Center and Logistics Hub, is equipped with a blood bank refrigerator and 20-kva generator set, and is capable of providing blood and blood products. “This is part of the realization of our dream to set up a blood facility in every corner of the country to make life-saving blood av...

item.title: PRC building in Manila evacuated after bomb threat - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PRC building in Manila evacuated after bomb threat  Sun.Star Philippines

THE office of the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) in Manila was evacuated Friday morning after a security officer received a bomb threat. One of the security guards allegedly received an anonymous call that a bomb was supposed to explode inside the PRC building located in Sampaloc, prompting security personnel to alert the Manila Police District. Employees and people had transactions with the PRC had been moved from the building as an explosive and ordnance team conducted search operation. Police closed the streets surrounding the building. At 1 p.m., employees were ordered to go ...

item.title: Red Cross, DSWD ink deal to capacitate poor families - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Red Cross, DSWD ink deal to capacitate poor families  Sun.Star Philippines

TACLOBAN CITY -- The Philippine Red Cross (PRC), through its seven chapters in Eastern Visayas region, inked a Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD) field office in strengthening and capacitating Pantawid Pamilyang Pilipino Program (4Ps) recipients. The PRC Secretary General Oscar Palabyab and DSWD Regional Director Restituto Macuto signed the MOA on Saturday together with key PRC officials from the region’s six provinces at La Rica Hotel in this city. The 4Ps beneficiaries in the region are encouraged to voluntarily become Red Cross memb...

item.title: 3 Baguio graduates top teacher licensure exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
3 Baguio graduates top teacher licensure exam  Sun.Star Philippines

THREE graduates of the Saint Louis University in Baguio City were among the Top 10 during the March 2017 Licensure Examinations for Teachers (LET). In the recently released results of LET, Erin Hyja Banayat Fabrigas garnered a rating of 87.40 to take the Top 10 in the elementary level while Melanie Locano Baniwas and Racquel Abretan Luban, both with 90.20 rating, both landed 10th in the secondary level. The Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) and the Board for Professional Teachers (BPT) said 5,600 elementary teachers out of 53,915 examinees passed the exam while only 18,482 secondary ...

item.title: Caraga grad tops forester board exams - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Caraga grad tops forester board exams  Sun.Star Philippines

BUTUAN CITY -- A student from the Caraga State University (CSU) took the top spot of the recently concluded September 2017 Forester board exam for the second year in a row. Victor Lobrigas Corbita from Barobo town in Surigao del Sur nailed the top spot with 91.20 percent. Six other CSU students also made it to the top 10 namely: Ailyn Mesias Dela Peña who took the third rank with 90.85 percent, on the fourth is Edu Daamo Casugudan Jr with 90.40 percent, Helen Dahan Cuizon with 90.20 percent on the fifth spot, Liezel Asumbrado Cortejos and Marcelyn Dalaygon Lavilla tied the seventh place at ...

item.title: 2 Dabawenyos top Architect Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
2 Dabawenyos top Architect Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

TWO Dabawenyos made it to the top ten passers of the Architecture Licensure Exam (ALE) for June 2017. Marion Lyndon Demaisip from the University of Mindanao-Davao City placed fourth with 82.8 percent, while Charisse Jheline Ang of Ateneo de Davao University (ADDU) ranked sixth with 82.5 percent. Topping the Architect Board exam is Jefferson Ventura from Saint Louis University with 84.70 percent, followed by Aldous Olbes from Pamantasan ng Lungsod ng Maynila (2nd, 84.30 percent), and Judy An Larin from Bulacan State University (3rd, 82.90%). Sharing the fifth spot after Demaisip are Danielin...

item.title: Application for March 2017 Teachers Exam now open - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Application for March 2017 Teachers Exam now open  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Professional Regulation Commission-Baguio Regional Office is now accepting applications for the March 26, 2017 Board Licensure Examination for Teachers. Deadline for filing of application for new or first-time and repeater applicants is on January 20, 2017. For First-time applicants, requirements include original and photocopy of Transcript of Records with scanned picture and remarks, “For Board Examination Purposes”; original and photocopy of PSA/NSO-issued Birth Certificate issued in security paper;oOriginal and photocopy of PSA/NSO-issued Marriage Certificate in security paper(for ma...

item.title: 86 pass master plumber exam in Middle East - ABS CBN News
item.description:
86 pass master plumber exam in Middle East  ABS CBN News

Eighty-six examinees passed the Master Plumber Licensure Examination given by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) in the Middle East. A total of 175 took the exam, which was given by the Board for Master Plumbers in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates; Al-Khobar, Jeddah and Riyadh, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia; Doha, Qatar and in Kuwait in September 2016. ROLL OF SUCCESSFUL EXAMINEES HERE.

item.title: PRC sets renewal of licenses in Dumaguete City - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PRC sets renewal of licenses in Dumaguete City  Sun.Star Philippines

IT’S all systems go for the renewal of licenses by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) on December 10 at the Robinson’s Place shopping mall in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. The PRC mobile licensing renewal will cater to all professionals and license holders who are encouraged to avail of the services so they no longer have to travel to Cebu, said Ma. Socorro Mira, head of the Public Employment Service Office (Peso) of Dumaguete City. The PRC is partnering with Peso for the mobile renewal of licenses, where applicants are requested to pre-register, said Mira on Monday, November 2...

item.title: CIT-U grad ranks 1st in Mining Engineer Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CIT-U grad ranks 1st in Mining Engineer Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE from Cebu Institute of Technology-University (CIT-U) made it to the top spot of the August 2017 Mining Licensure Examination. The results were announced by the Professional Regulations Commission (PRC) on Monday, August 14. Pompeii Nikolai SubingSubing of CIT-U ranked first with an average of 90.90 percent. Philip Santi Morgia of the University of the Philippines-Diliman landed on the second spot with 89.80 percent, followed by Gelaine Chavez Cabria on the third spot with 89.55 percent. See the full list of examinees here: List of successful examinees of the August 2017 Mining En...

item.title: One-stop shop for OFWs serves 2,218 workers in Eastern Visayas - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
One-stop shop for OFWs serves 2,218 workers in Eastern Visayas  Sun.Star Philippines

THE one-stop service center of the Philippine Overseas Employment Administration (POEA) field office in Tacloban City has served some 2,218 applicants and vacationing overseas Filipino workers (OFW). At least 11 national government agencies have set up their desk at the POEA field office in the city to process documentary requirements of overseas workers under one roof since September 6, 2016. Marlon Macalla, officer-in-charge of POEA field office in Tacloban, said the Overseas Workers Welfare Administration has the highest number of OFWs served at 1,069 between September to December 2016. ...

item.title: Cebu grad tops Medical Technologist Licensure Exam - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Cebu grad tops Medical Technologist Licensure Exam  Sun.Star Philippines

A GRADUATE of Cebu City made it into the top ten of the August 2017 Medical Technologist Licensure Examination, the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced on Thursday, August 31. Louis Joseph Gaviola Lafuente of Velez College made it to the ninth rank with a score of 90.10 percent. Marianne Ross Bacia Soldevilla of Notre Dame of Marbel University got the first place with 90.90 percent, while Glenn Charls Lagumbay Buelis of the University of the Immaculate Conception-Davao got the second place with a score of 90.80 percent. Cebu Doctors' University is among the country's top perf...

item.title: Top 10 best performing elementary teaching schools in PH - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Top 10 best performing elementary teaching schools in PH  ABS CBN News

More than 23,000 elementary teachers passed the Licensure Examination for Teachers (LET) given by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) and the Board for Professional Teachers (BPT) in September 2016. A total of 23,378 out of 77,466 examinees hurdled the board exams for elementary teachers held in various testing centers. Here are the best performing elementary teaching schools in the Philippines, based on the September 2016 LET. The PRC divided the list into two groups, one for elementary and another for secondary level. Only schools that had 50 or more examinees and with at least 8...

item.title: Media orgs, private groups partner with Red Cross for blood donation - Rappler
item.description:
Media orgs, private groups partner with Red Cross for blood donation  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Staff from 62 organizations will be donating blood every year, as part of a newly signed deal with the Philippine Red Cross (PRC). These groups signed a memorandum of agreement (MOA) during the 2017 Blood Service Partners' Engagement Ceremony on Wednesday, July 12. The MOA comes as the PRC celebrates World Blood Donor Month. Senator Richard Gordon, chairman of the PRC, highlighted the importance of the media in bloodletting activities. Among those that inked the agreement are Rappler, GMA Kapuso Foundation, CNN Philippines, and Bombo Radyo. "This will be a partnership ...

item.title: New law regulates criminology profession - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
New law regulates criminology profession  SunStar Philippines

PRESIDENT Rodrigo Duterte has signed into law a measure regulating the practice of criminology profession in the Philippines. Duterte's Republic Act 11131 (RA), otherwise known as The Philippine Criminology Profession Act 2018, effectively repeals RA 6506 that created the Board of Examiners for criminologists in the country. RA 11131 governs the examination, registration and licensure for criminologists; supervision, control, and regulation of the practice of criminology, standardization and regulation of criminology education; development of the professional competence of criminologists; a...

item.title: Albay graduate tops Midwife Licensure Exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Albay graduate tops Midwife Licensure Exam  SunStar Philippines

THE Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) announced Wednesday, November 7, that 1,175 out of 2,478 examinees passed the Midwife Licensure Examination given in November this year. Topping the list of passers is a graduate of Immaculate Conception College in Albay province who got a passing rate of 90.75 percent. Here's the list of the top 10 passers: 1. Excelsia Rebeka Maree Lobete Basco of Immaculate Conception College-Albay -- 90.75 percent 2. Darlene Villanueva Mendoza of Brokenshire College Soccsksargen Inc. -- 90.30 percent 3. Gellian Labagis Alaurin of Calayan Educational Foundation...

item.title: DMSF listed among top 10 performing schools in physician exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
DMSF listed among top 10 performing schools in physician exam  SunStar Philippines

THE Davao Medical School Foundation (DMSF) ranked sixth among the top 10 performing schools in September 2018 Physician Licensure Examination. Among the 162 DMSF graduates who took the exam, 157 passed the examination, giving the school a 96.91-percent passing rate. Of those who passed, 154 were first time takers while three were retakers. Based on the list released by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC), the Cebu Institute of Medicine is the top performing medical school in the country with a passing rate of 99.33 percent. Taking the second spot is the University of Santo Tomas wi...

item.title: Mendoza: CPD law, for or against it - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Mendoza: CPD law, for or against it  SunStar Philippines

WHEN this law came into being, professionals throughout the Philippines met it with various reactions, most of them negative because of the cost that it entails before one can renew his/her PRC ID Card. Yes, take note that it is the card and not the license that we are renewing. It can be recalled that Republic Act No. 10912, otherwise known as the “Continuing Professional Development (CPD) Act of 2016”, is an act which requires CPD as the mandatory requirement for the renewal of Professional Identification Card. The CPD Act lapsed into Law on July 21, 2016 and it took effect on August 16, ...

item.title: Mendoza: CSC’s Omnibus rules on appointment revised - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Mendoza: CSC’s Omnibus rules on appointment revised  SunStar Philippines

THE Civil Service Commission (CSC) in a press release revealed that the Revised Omnibus Rules on Appointments and Other Human Resource Actions (ORAOHRA)— a consolidation of rules pertaining to appointment, promotion, reassignment, separation, and other human resource actions in the civil service took effect on last August 26. It could be recalled that the previous version of the ORAOHRA was promulgated on June 16, 2017 and since its implementation, the Commission took into consideration the feedback from its stakeholders that prompted them to amend the policy to ensure that its provisions a...

item.title: UP Manila academic employees union slam Ramon Tulfo for 'abusive behavior' - Rappler
item.description:
UP Manila academic employees union slam Ramon Tulfo for 'abusive behavior'  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Faculty members and professional staff of the University of the Philippines (UP) in Manila slammed radio broadcaster and columnist Ramon Tulfo for his “abusive and atrocious behavior” at the Philippine General Hospital (PGH) earlier this week. The All UP Academic Employees Union-Manila Chapter, which includes PGH doctors and consultants, issued the statement on Friday, August 17, a day after the incident involving Tulfo. “The All UP Academic Employees Union-Manila Chapter, representing the faculty and the research, extension, and professional staff (REPS) of the Univer...

item.title: Tax Academy gets PRC accreditation - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Tax Academy gets PRC accreditation  SunStar Philippines

THE Philippine Tax Academy (PTA) has secured the accreditation of the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) as a professional development program provider, according to the Department of Finance (DOF). DOF Undersecretary Gil Beltran said that with this accreditation, courses and training programs offered by the PTA can be credited as continuing professional development (CPD) units for certified public accountants (CPAs). “The training programs offered by the PTA will be submitted to the PRC for approval and accreditation,” Beltran said in his report to Finance Secretary Carlos Dominguez ...

item.title: Senate approves regulatory board for fisheries - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Senate approves regulatory board for fisheries  SunStar Philippines

THE Senate, voting 21-0, approved on third and final reading on Wednesday, August 8, a measure seeking to establish a professional regulatory board and legal framework to regulate the fisheries profession. Senate Bill No. 1641 was approved with 21 affirmative votes, zero negative vote and no abstention. Senator Antonio Trillanes IV, who sponsored the bill, said the measure would "establish quality standards for fisheries professionals that would guide fisheries schools or colleges in updating their curriculum." Under the bill, a 'Professional Board of Fisheries' will be created under the su...

item.title: 2 Cebu grads top pharmacist board exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
2 Cebu grads top pharmacist board exam  SunStar Philippines

TWO Cebuanas made it to the top 10 of the Pharmacist Licensure Examination given by the Professional Regulation Commission last Aug. 4 to 5 this year. Louise Theunis, a graduate of the Cebu Doctors’ University (CDU), held the top spot out of the 4,230 test-takers with a score of 91.55 percent while Danixzyle Cutamora from the University of San Carlos placed eight with a score of 90.88 percent. Theunis is the first Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy graduate of CDU who was included in the top 10 and became the first placer of the exam. She was an academic scholar and a president’s lister during...

item.title: Cebu Doctors' University grad tops August Pharmacist Licensure Exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Cebu Doctors' University grad tops August Pharmacist Licensure Exam  SunStar Philippines

A GRADUATE of Cebu Doctors' University (CDU) and another of University of San Carlos (USC) have made it to the top 10 in the Pharmacist Licensure Examination held in August this year. Louise Tan Theunis of CDU topped the list, with a rating of 91.55 percent. Danixzyle Sevilleno Cutamora of USC placed 8th, with a passing rate of 90.88 percent. The other passers are: * (2nd) Euriel Jasmin Pakinggan Caparas of Centro Escolar University-Manila -- 91.40 percent * (3rd) Patrick Joshua Torres Galura of the University of Santo Tomas -- 91.35 percent * (4th) Biehn Beryl Cheng Que of University of Sa...

item.title: UAP District C-1 to hold Joint Induction Ceremony - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
UAP District C-1 to hold Joint Induction Ceremony  SunStar Philippines

IN pursuit of uniting registered and licensed architects in the Philippines, the United Architects of the Philippines (UAP) District C-1 will hold a Joint Induction District and Chapter Officers and Oathtaking of the New Members of the organization. The ceremony will be on Friday, Aug. 10, at 6 p.m. in Cebu Country Club, Cebu City. On the occasion, the pioneering officers and new members from the District C-1 chapters will be presented. In attendance would be approximately 300 incoming guests, which include National Officers of the UAP, Area VP, District Council and officers and members fro...

item.title: 2 UM grads top Criminology exam - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
2 UM grads top Criminology exam  SunStar Philippines

TWO University of Mindanao (UM) graduates topped the recently-conducted Criminologist Licensure Exam (CLE) based on results released by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) on Friday, June 29. Hana Jane Baritogo Franco from the UM–Digos College topped the list by garnering the highest rating of 90.90 percent while UM Tagum graduate Michelle Binosa Isaloc Langamon followed with 89.75 percent rating. The UM main campus in Davao City got 89.01 percent passing rate with 170 passers out of 191 takers. There were 7,307 takers for the CLE June 2018 and of this figure, 21,894 (33.37%) exami...

item.title: 4 Oro criminology grads in licensure exam’s top 10 - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
4 Oro criminology grads in licensure exam’s top 10  SunStar Philippines

FOUR graduates of Cagayan de Oro City schools landed in the top 10 of the Criminologist Licensure Examination, according to the results released by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) on Friday, June 29. Three of the four are Easter Marie Senieres who placed 5th with an 88.60 percent rating; Cristy Annababe Jamero, 7th with 88.45 percent rating; and Lady Lyn Legaspi secured the ninth spot with 88.30 percent rating, all graduates of Cagayan de Oro College-Phinma. Harley Glenn Galpo, who placed 10th with 88.25 percent rating, is a graduate of Capitol University. There were 21,894 who...

item.title: 4 Kagay-anons land in Nursing board’s top 10 - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
4 Kagay-anons land in Nursing board’s top 10  SunStar Philippines

FOUR takers of the 2018 Nursing Licensure Examination (NLE) from Cagayan de Oro City have landed in the top 10, according to results released by the Professional Regulation Commission (PRC) on Tuesday, June 19. Three Xavier University-Ateneo de Cagayan takers, Andrew Rey Del Fierro and Philip Gabriel Gimotea both ranked second with 87.20 rating while Ellein Jericka Tong secured the 10th place with the rating of 85.40. Emman Parangue of Capitol University placed fourth with an 86.60 rating. Out of 9,873 who took the examination last June 3 to 4, 43.82 percent or 4,326 successfully passed the...
